name: Kraków Main Market Square
description: Europe's largest medieval square, home to the Cloth Hall and St. Mary's Basilica. The square dates back to the 13th century and is the heart of Kraków's social life.

name: Warsaw Old Town
description: Beautifully reconstructed UNESCO site, a symbol of resilience after WWII destruction.

name: Gdańsk Crane (Żuraw)
description: A historic port crane and one of the most distinctive landmarks on the Motława River. It was both a port crane and a city gate.

name: Malbork Castle
description: The largest castle in the world by land area, built by the Teutonic Knights. It's a UNESCO World Heritage site and a masterpiece of Gothic architecture.

name: Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial
description: The site of the largest German Nazi concentration and extermination camp, preserved as a memorial to the victims of the Holocaust.

name: Tatra Mountains (Zakopane)
description: The highest range in the Carpathian Mountains, offering stunning alpine landscapes, hiking, and winter sports near the town of Zakopane.
